@graph.schema:description: In mathematics and computer science, an algorithm is a finite sequence of rigorous instructions, typically used to solve a class of specific problems or to perform a computation.

A heuristic is an approach to problem solving that may not be fully specified or may not guarantee correct or optimal results, especially in problem domains where there is no well-defined correct or optimal result.

Social media recommender systems rely on heuristics in such a way that, although widely characterized as 'algorithms' in 21st century popular media, cannot deliver correct results due to the nature of the problem.
